text: we know things like volume weighted average price is really important it helps us understand what people are willing to pay for something volume profile allows you to visualize this exact thing for whatever ticker it is that you're looking at welcome back to another quick tips where you get tips quick let's talk about volume profile I get asked about this one a lot and it's super simple to set up so the whole point of volume profile is this cre Ates what we refer to as volume nodes and these are kind of like these little Peaks that jump out from the left hand side these little Peaks represent the number of transactions that occur at the price that you're hovering on so on thinker swim as I hover on this price level right here it's 81 and change this tells us that within this range here a pretty decent number of people have traded at this level and you can see that there's a big volume note here a really big one down here this dashed line is referred to as the point of control that's where the most volume occurred in the um time frame that you're looking at now one of the cool things with thinker swim is that the volume profile will automatically match the aggregation period is that you're looking at so right now this is telling you over the last 6 months daily time frames where the volume has occurred in what

you're looking at now one of the cool things with thinker swim is that the volume profile will automatically match the aggregation period is that you're looking at so right now this is telling you over the last 6 months daily time frames where the volume has occurred in what frequency at what price level level if I move this out to a onee you'll notice that things move around they shift and on a one-year time frame you'll notice that there's a big old volume node now here and if I move this into a 3-month time frame you'll notice that the point of control jumps from down in 24 up to 75 and that's because in the past 3 months this is where the majority of volume has occurred at this price level so the really cool thing in reason why I like volume profile so much is when we're looking and analyzing markets charting can sometimes feel like astrology but realistically if you break it down to its Bare Bones case it's literally the visual representation of supply and demand this tells us where people are willing to buy things meaning where what price and in what quantity so we can tell that as we get down here to this 75 handle that at least over the last 3 months there's obviously a lot of people that are willing to transact at this 75 handle if I zoom this out now then to 6 months and we

quantity so we can tell that as we get down here to this 75 handle that at least over the last 3 months there's obviously a lot of people that are willing to transact at this 75 handle if I zoom this out now then to 6 months and we take a look at that same 75 handle what do you notice it's still a really dominant region on this chart typically where you see these volume nodes you will find congestion you will find consolidation of some sort and obviously it just kind of makes sense right if a bunch of people are transacting on something at a price level then that that's going to mean that there's more volume at that price level it's kind of you know self-explanatory in that way then when you have these big transient style moves you tend to have very light volume nodes or even gaps in between them those gaps become areas that price tends to move very quickly through so to set this up the way that I have it set up which is definitely different than the automatic setting that thinker swim will give you I'll walk you through that right now we're going to go into studies up here and then we're going to hit edit studies and then we're going to go down to volume profile if you don't have it on this side over here you literally type it in over here and then you can

that right now we're going to go into studies up here and then we're going to hit edit studies and then we're going to go down to volume profile if you don't have it on this side over here you literally type it in over here and then you can add it to this side notice how the volume profile is up in the price axis not as volume or other lower graphs and if we come in here and we hit the settings I want to walk you through the way that I set it up again you can set this up however you want there's one really key thing that you have to pay attention to and the rest is just preference so you can set different heights you don't really have to mess with that the time per profile what I do is I automatically set it to adapt to the Chart I don't use any multiplier this is one of the settings that you have to be aware of which is on expansion if it is not on expansion and I click yes you're going to notice it's going to dump it over here and this is way less usable for me and the way that I trade so I always move on expansion to no and then you'll notice that it kind of overlays it with everything else I find this much more useful a couple other settings that you should be aware of the

is way less usable for me and the way that I trade so I always move on expansion to no and then you'll notice that it kind of overlays it with everything else I find this much more useful a couple other settings that you should be aware of the value area percent I don't really even plot the value area that's simply where the most volume transacted at at you know price range I don't use it that much the opacity is important because if you don't turn this to the correct level it will look much deeper than it should or it'll even block out the price so for example if I change this to 100 And we apply it washes out the entire chart right so that's why I typically find 20 is pretty good that's this and sometimes you can go even lighter that's fine now one of thing that people miss all the time because it's not easy to find is down here under globals if you click globals you can change the color for the point of control versus the entire width of the profile meaning these sections as compared to the value area so if you want the point of control to be something that's a little more visible like maybe if I add this blue to it just for the example you can kind of see that this line gets to be a little more distinct I don't bother using it cuz
